title: Pretzel Millionaire Bars
instructions_raw: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line an 8x8-inch square pan with enough parchment paper to have overhang on all sides.

For crust, beat butter, sugar, and salt together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla and beat until thoroughly combined. Mix in pretzel crumbs. Mixture will be somewhat sticky.
Pour dough into the prepared pan and press evenly into the bottom of the pan with the back of a silicone spatula.
Bake in the preheated oven until crust begins to turn golden, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool while preparing filling.

For filling, add brown sugar, butter, water, corn syrup, and salt to a heavy-bottomed sauce pot over medium-low heat. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring constantly, and boil for 5 minutes. Carefully pour in cream, stirring constantly. Bring mixture back up to a boil and continue to cook for an additional 20 minutes, stirring frequently, until an instant-read thermometer reads 245 degrees F (113 degrees C). Remove pan from heat and stir in vanilla and lemon juice.
Carefully pour hot filling over crust. Place pan into the freezer until filling is cool to the touch, 30 to 40 minutes.

For topping, place chocolate chips, cream, and corn syrup into a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on 50% power in 30 second intervals, stirring after each interval, until mixture is melted and combined. Pour chocolate over the top of the chilled filling, and spread into an even layer. Gently press extra pretzels into the chocolate, if desired. Refrigerate bars until chocolate has firmed up, about 1 hour.

Remove bars from the pan using the parchment overhang. Carefully peel off parchment paper. Run a knife under hot water and wipe dry with a towel. Cut into 16 bars using the hot knife, wiping the blade clean after each cut.

title: Kitchen Sink Cookie Bars
ingredients_raw: 1/2 cup coarsely crushed ruffled potato chips , divided
1/2 cup coarsely chopped mini pretzels , divided
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons candy-coated milk chocolate pieces, divided, such as M&M’s®
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons semisweet chocolate chips , divided
instructions_raw: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease a 8-inch square baking pan with baking spray and line with parchment paper, letting parchment overhang on all sides by at least 1 inch.
Whisk together flour, brown sugar, white sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl until well combined.

Add melted butter, egg yolks, and vanilla to flour mixture; whisk until combined. Fold in 1/4 cup potato chips, 1/4 cup pretzels, 1/4 cup candy-coated milk chocolate pieces, and 1/4 cup chocolate chips until evenly dispersed.
Transfer dough to the prepared pan; place a sheet of plastic wrap directly on surface, and press dough into an even layer. Remove and discard plastic wrap.
Top dough evenly with remaining potato chips, pretzels, candy-coated milk chocolate pieces, and chocolate chips, pressing them lightly into dough to help adhere.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are just starting to pull away from sides of pan and top is golden brown, 22 to 25 minutes. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack, about 2 hours.
Using parchment paper, lift from pan and cut into 16 bars.

title: Chicken Mole Enchilada Casserole
ingredients_raw: 1 (8.25 ounce) jar mole sauce, such as Dona Maria® brand
instructions_raw: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Add mole sauce to a saucepan. Slowly whisk in chicken broth and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. The mixture should be smooth.
Combine 2 cups of sauce with the chicken in a bowl.
Dip tortillas in the remaining sauce, removing any excess and set aside.

Place 6 tortillas in the prepared baking dish, cutting to fit as needed. Add half of the chicken mixture and 1 1/3 cup of the cheese. Repeat with a second layer, then top with the remaining tortillas and sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Add remaining 1 1/3 cups cheese and bake until cheese is melted and casserole is bubbly, about 10 minutes.
Top with sour cream, pickled red onion, and cilantro for serving.

title: Orange Cranberry Ricotta Cookies
instructions_raw: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line 3 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl; set aside.
Beat together butter and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Add ricotta cheese and cream cheese; beat well. Add egg, milk, orange zest, and vanilla extract; beat until just combined.
Beat in flour mixture until just combined. Fold in dried cranberries.

Scoop dough into 20 portions using a 3-tablespoon (#20) scoop. Arrange dough portions 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Flatten cookies slightly with the bottom of a glass dipped in sugar.
Bake in the preheated oven until bottoms are lightly golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer cookies to a wire rack and allow to cool.
For the glaze, whisk together powdered sugar, orange zest, orange juice, and whipping cream in a small bowl.
Dip tops of cooled cookies into the glaze. Sprinkle with chopped dried cranberries, if desired.

title: Baked Green Bean Bundles
ingredients_raw: 1 pound bacon, each slice cut in half
instructions_raw: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment or foil and arrange bacon in a single layer.
Bake bacon in the preheated oven until partially cooked yet still pliable, 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool until cool enough to handle. Leave the oven on.
Wrap each piece of bacon around 6 to 8 green beans and secure with a toothpick. Place green bean bundles in a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Combine butter, Worcestershire, soy sauce, and brown sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring mixture to a simmer, stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved. Pour mixture over green beans and toss lightly to ensure each bundle is evenly coated.
Bake bundles for 30 minutes, turning over halfway through, until sauce is thickened, green beans are tender, and bacon is fully cooked.

title: Easy Oven Beef Tenderloin
ingredients_raw: 2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste
1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper , or to taste
instructions_raw: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Place tenderloin at room temperature about 30 to 45 minutes before cooking.

Stir butter and soy sauce together; rub mixture over the entire tenderloin. Sprinkle evenly with salt and pepper on all sides. Place tenderloin on a foil-lined baking sheet. Fold the thin tail end underneath so that the tenderloin is at an even thickness.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until desired degree of doneness (25 minutes will yield rare-medium rare). Let stand for 20 to 30 minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Easy Peppermint Bark Cheesecake
ingredients_raw: 1 (13.29 ounce) package chocolate sandwich cookie s, such as Oreo®
1 (24.3 ounce) container no-bake cheesecake filling, such as Philadelphia ®
1 cup finely chopped peppermint bark, plus more for topping
instructions_raw: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9-inch springform pan.
Process cookies in a food processor until finely ground. Add melted butter and pulse until just combined. Press cookie mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan.
Bake crust in the preheated oven until just fragrant, about 10 minutes. Let cool completely.
Beat cream and confectioner’s sugar together with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Set aside.
Stir together cheesecake filling and chopped peppermint bark until well combined. Fold in whipped cream, spread mixture evenly over crust, and smooth the top.
Sprinkle the top with additional peppermint bark and place in the freezer to set up, at least 2 hours.
Let stand at room temperature for 10 to 15 minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Green Goddess Edamame Dip
ingredients_raw: 1/4 cup chopped chives or tops of green onions
2 tablespoons avocado oil or sesame oil, or a combination of both
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions_raw: Bring a medium-sized pot of salted water to a gentle boil. Add edamame and boil for 2 minutes. Add peas; boil for 3 minutes more. Reserve 2 teaspoons hot water; drain beans and let cool slightly, about 10 minutes.
Add edamame and peas, chives, cilantro, and garlic to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse for 1 minute to combine. Add ginger paste, chili flakes, soy sauce and 1 tablespoon oil.

Pulse again to combine. Scrape down the sides, then add another 1 tablespoon of oil. Pulse again, then taste, and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle in reserved hot water to loosen and pulse again.

title: Hot Honey Butter
ingredients_raw: 1/2 cup unsalted butter , room temperature, cubed
2 teaspoons hot sauce , or to taste
1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes , or to taste
instructions_raw: Add butter, hot sauce, red pepper flakes, and salt to a small bowl. Use an electric mixer, and whip until butter is light and fluffy.
Stir in honey and sage until well combined. Taste, and adjust seasonings, if necessary.
Transfer to an airtight container, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour for the flavors to develop.

title: Leftover Brown Rice and Mushroom Pilaf
ingredients_raw: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1/2 cup chicken broth or vegetable broth
instructions_raw: Melt butter in a large, nonstick skillet over medium heat. When butter stops sizzling, add shallots and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onions begin to turn translucent, about 3 minutes.
Stir in mushrooms and thyme, and cook about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, and stir in garlic and slivered almonds. Cook until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add broth, and cook for 1 minute, then stir in cooked brown rice. Cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired, and serve warm.

title: Potato Cheese Kartoffelkaese
ingredients_raw: 2 Yukon gold potatoes , peeled and cut into chunks
instructions_raw: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until fork tender, about 30 minutes. Drain. Place potatoes in a bowl.
Mash potatoes slightly with a fork or potato masher. Add green onions, sour cream, cumin, salt, and pepper and stir until smooth. Serve with pretzels, bread, or chips.

title: Savory Rice Krispies Treats
ingredients_raw: 3 tablespoons minced chile seasoned dried mango , such as Trader Joe’s®
1/2 teaspoon flaky sea salt , such as Maldon®, or to taste
6 cups crispy rice cereal , such as Rice Krispies®
instructions_raw: Spray a 9-inch square baking pan with cooking spray, and line with parchment paper. Leave an overhang on 2 sides to act as a sling for easy removal.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Saute, stirring occasionally, until the milk solids at the bottom start to turn golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low, and add sesame seeds, chile spiced mango, and sun-dried tomatoes. Saute for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Fold in marshmallows and salt, and stir until fully melted and combined, 5 to 9 minutes. Turn off the heat and stir in sesame oil.
Add cereal and quickly fold and stir with a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. Scrape the sticky mixture into the pan; press in evenly with an offset spatula or the back of a spoon.
Cool completely before removing from the pan. Slice into bars or squares. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

title: Granny Kat's Pumpkin Roll
instructions_raw: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch jelly roll pan or line with parchment paper.
Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, and pumpkin pie spice in a large bowl. Stir in pumpkin puree, eggs, and lemon juice until just blended. Spread mixture evenly into prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until cake springs back when lightly touched, about 15 minutes.

Lay a damp linen towel on the counter, sprinkle it with confectioners' sugar, and turn the cake onto the towel. Remove parchment paper if you used it. Carefully roll the towel up lengthwise (starting at the narrow end) with the warm cake in it. Place the cake-in-towel on a cooling rack and let it cool completely, about 1 to 2 hours.
To make the icing: Blend cream cheese, butter, vanilla, and sugar in a medium bowl with a wooden spoon or electric mixer. Chill icing until cake has cooled.
Unroll cooled cake and spread icing onto it. Immediately re-roll (not in the towel this time), and wrap it with plastic wrap. Chill the cake to set before slicing.

title: Sheet Pan Lasagna
ingredients_raw: 4 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed
2 cloves garlic , minced, or more to taste
4 cups marinara sauce such as Rao's®
instructions_raw: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a 12x17-inch baking sheet with 1 to 2 tablespoons olive oil for a thin, crisp sheet-pan version, or use a 9x13-inch baking dish for a cozier, “pasta bake” feel.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add spinach and salt; cook, stirring, until wilted, about 3 minutes.
Transfer spinach to a bowl. Use kitchen shears to roughly chop, then stir in ricotta cheese. Set aside.

Wipe out the frying pan with a paper towel. Add remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil and sausage. Cook undisturbed for 1 to 2 minutes to get some browning, then break sausage apart with a spatula. Continue cooking until browned throughout, about 5 minutes. Add red onion and sauté until softened, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat.

Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add lasagna sheets and cook for 4 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Drain and return to the pot. If you aren’t immediately mixing with the sauce mixture (next step), toss pasta in a drizzle of olive oil to prevent sticking.
Stir marinara sauce into sausage mixture. Pour sausage and sauce into the pot with pasta. Add 1 1/2 cups mozzarella and 1 cup Parmesan, stirring until evenly coated.
Spread pasta mixture evenly on the prepared baking sheet or in the baking dish. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Spoon or dollop the spinach-ricotta mixture across the surface.
Bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, until cheese is golden, sauce is bubbling, and edges are lightly crisped, about 30 minutes.
Serve warm with extra marinara sauce and a sprinkle of cheese, if desired. Enjoy!

title: Cheesy Pepper Jelly Bites
ingredients_raw: fresh thyme or chopped chives, for garnish (optional)
instructions_raw: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and lightly grease a 24-cup mini muffin pan with nonstick spray.

Unfold the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and roll it just enough to smooth out the creases. Cut into 24 equal squares (4 across and 6 down works perfectly). Press 1 pastry square into each muffin cup.
Bake in the preheated oven until the pastry begins to puff and turn lightly golden, 10 to 12 minutes.
Cut cream cheese into 24 small cubes. Gently press 1 cube into each puff pastry cup, then top with about 1 teaspoon of pepper jelly.
Return the pan to the oven; bake until the pastry is golden and the cream cheese is warmed through, 8 to 10 minutes more.
Let the bites cool in the pan for 5 to 10 minutes before removing. Sprinkle with thyme or chives and serve warm. Enjoy!

title: Lasagna Mozzarella Sticks
ingredients_raw: 2 cups oil for frying, or as needed
instructions_raw: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, and cook lasagna sheets according to package instructions. Separate each noodle and spray with oil or cooking spray to keep them from sticking together.
Spread a thin layer of pimento cheese onto each noodle. Cut each noodle in half lengthwise.
Place 1 halved mozzarella cheese stick onto 1 side of the noodle and roll inside the noodle as tightly as you can. Repeat with each noodle and place onto a baking sheet or plate.
Place one halved mozzarella cheese stick onto one side of the noodle and roll inside the noodle as tightly as you can. Repeat with each noodle and place onto a baking sheet or plate.
Place into the freezer for 1 hour.
Add eggs to a shallow bowl. Add panko to another shallow bowl.
Coat each cheese stick with beaten egg, then roll in panko; press panko gently to coat each stick completely.

Add oil to a depth of about 2 inches to a high-sided skillet or Dutch oven; heat to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Fry mozzarella sticks until an instant read thermometer inserted near the center reads 160 to 170 degrees F (71 to 77 degrees C) , 5 to 6 minutes.

title: Buttercrunch Cookie Bars
ingredients_raw: 1 pinch flaky salt or sea salt
instructions_raw: Melt butter on low to medium heat in a skillet. Once butter is melted and begins to crackle, start stirring; cook and stir until butter has a nutty aroma and begins to turn light brown or amber in color. Remove from heat and transfer browned butter into a large, heatproof bowl; set aside to cool until just warm to the touch.
Whisk flour, baking solda, and salt together in a bowl; set aside.
Whisk llight brown and white sugar into browned butter until smooth, then whisk in egg and vanilla.
Add flour mixture to butter mixture in increments, and fold together until a shaggy dough forms. Fold in 3/4 cup toffee bits until evenly dispersed.
Line an 8x8-inch baking pan wiht parchment. Spread dough evenly into the pan, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until chilled, at least 45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Sprinkle dough evenly with remaining toffee bits, and press them lightly into the dough.
Bake bars in the preheated oven until edges begin to turn golden brown and the middle looks set, 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with flaky salt. Cool for 30 minutes before serving.

title: Turkey Porchetta
ingredients_raw: 1 (2 1/2 pound) skin-on boneless turkey breast half
1 teaspoon toasted fennel seeds, crushed or finely minced
2 cups cold turkey or chicken broth
instructions_raw: Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).

Place turkey breast skin side down on a cutting board, and flip the tenderloin over towards the thinner end. Use a thin sharp knife, held at a slight angle to the cutting board, to slice into the center of the thickest part of the breast on the opposite side, Be careful not to cut all the way through. You're just trying to butterfly open that part of the breast to maximize surface area. Several more smaller, shallow cuts can be made on either side, wherever the meat is thick enough, to expose more surface area for the seasonings.

Season the exposed meat evenly with 2 teaspoons of the salt, black pepper, chili flakes, garlic, citrus zest, fennel, and rosemary. Fold and roll the turkey breast back together into its original shape; finish with the skin side up and the seam side down.
Use 4 pieces of kitchen twine to tie the turkey breast up securely, finishing with the knots on top. Trim off excess twine. and brush any exposed seasoning from the skin surface.

Grease a roasting pan with the olive oil, and transfer in the diced vegetables, distributing evenly. Place a roasting rack on top, and place turkey on the rack, skin side up. Sprinkle remaining salt on top of the skin.

Roast in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, then reduce oven temperature to 300 degrees F (149 degrees C), and continue roasting for about 45 minutes, or until the internal temperature in the center of the thickest part is 145 to 150 degrees F (62 to 66 degrees C). Time may vary depending on the size of the turkey breast.
Transfer turkey onto a plate and tent loosely with foil. Let rest 15 to 20 minutes before slicing.

Meanwhile, for gravy, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat and add the vegetables from the roasting pan. As soon as vegetables are sizzling, add flour, and cook, stirring, for about 2 minutes. Whisk in the cold broth, and turn the heat up to medium-high. Bring to a boil, whisking occasionally. Once the mixture comes to a boil and thickens, reduce heat to low. Taste for seasoning and adjust if need be. For best results strain the gravy before serving.
Once the turkey is rested, slice and serve with the hot gravy.
